cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 175 miles SSE of Nassau, Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across the north-central Bahamas, then turning north-northwest and skirting the Florida east coast before accelerating up the U.S. southeast coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Florida east coast between Boca Raton and the Jupiter Inlet

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: Jupiter Inlet to Ponte Vedra Beach FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Boca Raton to Volusia/Brevard County Line FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast and east-central Florida coastline from Miami-Dade County northward
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force winds (≥74 mph) possible late Saturday into Sunday; tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) likely beginning Saturday afternoon.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of inundation possible along the immediate coast and Intracoastal Waterway near the port under onshore flow.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with isolated amounts up to 6 inches could produce urban and flash flooding around the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; brief tornadoes in outer rain bands.
